chapter.title: Program Dependency Board
chapter.p: The Program Dependency Board allows you to manage all dependencies within your program in one central location. The board will help you understand the progress of your dependencies at a high level.
The board's swimlanes are grouped by the dependency status.

item.strong: A new dependency has a raising card linked to it and has yet to be accepted by the resolving project.
An accepted dependency means that the resolving project has accepted the dependency by linking resolving card(s) to it.
A resolved dependency means that the resolving project has completed the dependency.

chapter.p: The board rows are grouped by all of the projects within your program.

section.title: Filtering the Program Dependency Board
section.p: The Program Dependency Board can be filtered by using the toggle and project drop down at the top left corner of the board. Toggle between raising or resolving dependencies based on the conversations you are having with your teams.
